P.HT: LIST OF FIELDS FOR THE QUALITATIVE DATA FILE

GR.SEQ.P: This table shall include the elements that provide the identification of the reporting credit rating agency including the legal identification, methodology and policies used.
This table shall contain one line for each reporting credit rating agency.

ROW.CELL: Code used to identify the reporting credit rating agency. It is provided by ESMA upon registration or certification.
Reporting CRA Global Legal Entity Identifier (LEI)
LEI code of the credit rating agency sending the file.

Name used to identify the credit rating agency. It shall correspond to the name used by the credit rating agency in the registration process and all other supervisory procedures within ESMA. Where one member of a group of credit rating agencies reports for the whole group it shall be the name referring to the group of credit rating agencies.
Brief description of the credit rating agency.
Description of the credit rating agency’s rating methodology. The credit rating agency can describe unique features of its rating methodology.
Link to CRA website methodology page
The link to the credit rating agency’s web page that contains all information related to the methodologies, and descriptions of models and key rating assumptions.

Description of the credit rating agency’s policy on solicited and unsolicited with or without participation ratings. If more than one policy exists, the relevant rating types applicable to each policy shall be specified.
Description of policy regarding the reporting of the rating of subsidiaries.

CELL.P: Mandatory.
Applicable for credit rating agencies issuing corporate ratings.

ROW.CELL: In the case of a credit rating agency part of a group, they should mention whether they report all the ratings issued by the group (global scope) or not (only the EU and endorsed ratings). Where the coverage is not global, the credit rating agency shall explain why not. For all other CRAs it should be reported as global (Y).

CELL.P: Y — yes
N — no

ROW.CELL: The reason why a credit rating agency which is part of a group, does not report all the ratings of the group.

CELL.P: Mandatory.
Applicable when Geographical reporting scope = N

ROW.CELL: Describes the definition of default used by the credit rating agency.
Link to the home page of credit rating agency’s public website.

GR.SEQ.P: This table shall be completed where the credit rating agency is issuing issuer credit ratings. The table shall have one line for each type of rating that is issued by the credit rating agency at issuer level.

ROW.CELL: Unique identifier for each issuer rating type that a rated entity can be assessed on.

CELL.P: Mandatory.
Applicable if the credit rating agency is issuing issuer ratings.

ROW.CELL: Name of the issuer rating category.
Description of the rated debt category.

This should distinguish the types of issuer ratings in: the main/global issuer credit rating, the debt rating type (the different categories will be described in Table 2, Part 2, Annex 1) and all other issuer debt ratings.

CELL.P: IR — Main issuer rating
DT — Debt rating
OT — Other

GR.SEQ.P: This table shall be completed where the credit rating agency is rating debt categories or debt issues/instruments (such as senior unsecured debt, subordinated unsecured debt, junior subordinated unsecured debt). The table shall have one line for each type of debt.

ROW.CELL: Unique identifier for each debt category used for classifying the corporate and sovereign issuer debt categories or debt issues.

CELL.P: Mandatory.
Applicable if the rating agency is rating corporate or sovereign debt categories

ROW.CELL: Name of the rated debt category.
Description of the rated debt category.
Identifies the seniority of the debt class of the rated issuer or issue.

CELL.P: SEU — in case the rated issuer debt or the issue belongs to the senior unsecured debt category
SEO — in case the rated issuer or the issue belongs to a senior debt category other than SEU
SB — in case the issuer debt or the issue belongs to a subordinated debt category.

GR.SEQ.P: This table shall be completed where the credit rating agency is rating debt issues/financial instruments.. The credit rating agency shall list all issue types or programmes under which the debts are issued, (such as note, medium term note, bonds, commercial paper). The table shall have one line for each such programme or issue type.

ROW.CELL: Unique identifier for each issue/programme used for classifying the issue ratings.

CELL.P: Mandatory.
Applicable if the credit rating agency is rating corporate or sovereign issues.

GR.SEQ.P: This table shall contain a list of all the lead analysts that operate in the Union. If a lead analyst worked in different time periods as a lead analyst (with time gaps in between) then the lead analyst should be reported in the table multiple times: one for each lead analyst appointment period. The start and end date of allocation to the function shall not overlap for the same lead analyst. The table shall contain one line for each lead analyst and distinct function period.

ROW.CELL: Internal unique identifiers of the staff member who is appointed in the analyst function by the credit rating agency.
The start date of the staff member in the lead analyst function.
The end date of the staff member in the lead analyst function If the staff member is currently working in the lead analyst function, it should be reported as 9999-01-01.

GR.SEQ.P: This table shall contain the description of all the credit rating scales used by the credit rating agencies for issuing credit ratings to be reported under this Regulation. The credit rating agencies shall report one line for each credit rating scale. For each credit rating scale reported, information about one or more rating categories can be reported in the Categories sub-table and about one or more notches can be reported in the Notches sub-report.

ROW.CELL: Identifies uniquely a specific rating scale of the credit rating agency.
The date at which the rating scale starts being valid.
The last date when a rating scale is valid. For the rating scale that re currently valid, it should be reported as 9999-01-01.
Description of the type of ratings included in the scale, including the geographical scope where relevant.
Identifies the applicability of the rating scale based on the time horizon.

CELL.P: L — where the rating scale is applicable to long-term ratings
S – where the rating scale is applicable to short-term ratings

ROW.CELL: Identifies the applicability of the rating scale based on the rating type.

CELL.P: C — where the rating scale is applicable to corporate ratings
S — where the rating scale is applicable to sovereign & public finance ratings
T — where the rating scale is applicable to structured finance ratings
O – where the rating scale is applicable to other financial instruments

ROW.CELL: Specifies if the rating scale is used for issuing preliminary ratings, final ratings or both.

CELL.P: PR — rating scale is used for issuing preliminary ratings only
FR — rating scale is used for issuing final ratings only
BT — rating scale is used for issuing preliminary and final ratings
Indicates if the rating is to be used by ESMA for the central repository (CEREP) statistics calculations.
For any given period, only one rating scale per combination of rating type and time horizon can be used.
Y — yes
N — no

ROW.CELL: Order of the rating category in the rating scale (where 1 is correspondent to the category that represents the best creditworthiness).

The ordinal is an integer value with minimum value 1 and a maximum value of 20. The declaration of the rating categories values must be consecutive. There must be as a minimum one rating category for each rating.
Identifies a specific rating category within the rating scale.
Definition of the rating category in the rating scale.
Order of the notch in the rating scale (where 1 is correspondent to the notch that represents the best creditworthiness).
The notch value is an integer with minimum value 1 and a maximum value of 99. Values provided must be consecutive. There must be as a minimum one rating notch for each rating.
Identifies a specific notch within the rating scale. Notches provide additional detail to the rating category.
Description of the notch in the rating scale.

P.HT: LIST OF FIELDS FOR THE RATING DATA FILE

GR.SEQ.P: This table shall identify and describe all credit ratings issued by the credit rating agency and are to be reported for the scope of this Regulation. This table shall contain one line for each individual credit rating to be reported. Where it applies, for each credit rating line, one or more Originators can be reported.

ROW.CELL: Code used to identify the reporting credit rating agency. It is provided by ESMA upon registration or certification.
LEI code of the credit rating agency sending the file.

CELL.P: LEI code of the credit rating agency responsible for the rating, i.e. in case of:

ITEM.P: a rating issued in the Union, the registered credit rating agency that has issued the rating,
an endorsed rating, the registered credit rating agency that endorsed the rating,
a rating issued by a certified credit rating agency, the certified credit rating agency,
a rating issued in a third country but not endorsed by a registered credit rating agency, the third country credit rating agency that issued the rating.

CELL.P: LEI code of the credit rating agency that issued the rating, that is to say in case of:

ITEM.P: a rating issued in the Union, the registered credit rating agency,
an endorsed rating, the third country credit rating agency that has issued the endorsed rating,
a rating issued by a certified credit rating agency, the certified entity,
a rating issued in a third country but not endorsed by a registered credit rating agency, the third country credit rating agency that issued the rating.

ROW.CELL: Unique identifier of the rating, which shall be maintained unchanged over time. The rating identifier shall be unique in all reports to ESMA.

Identifies whether the rating is a corporate rating, a sovereign or public finance rating, a structured finance rating or other financial instrument rating. It shall be maintained unchanged over time.

CELL.P: C — if the rating is applicable to corporate ratings
S — if the rating is applicable to sovereign ratings
T — if the rating is applicable to structured finance ratings
O — if the rating is applicable to other financial instruments.

ROW.CELL: Describes the type of rated financial instrument that was reported in the O rating type.

CELL.P: Mandatory.
Applicable for Rating type = O.

ROW.CELL: Specifies if the rating refers to an entity/issuer of debt or a debt issuance of a rated entity/financial instrument.

CELL.P: ISR — the rating refers to an entity or issuer of debt
INT — the rating refers to a debt issuance/financial instrument.

ROW.CELL: Identifies whether the rating is a short-term or a long-term rating. It shall be maintained unchanged over time.

CELL.P: L — if the rating is a long-term rating
S — if the rating is a short-term rating.

ROW.CELL: Country code of the rated entity/instrument.

CELL.P: ISO 3166-1 code.
The code ZZ shall be used to identify the category international.

ROW.CELL: Identifies whether the rating is expressed in respect of local or foreign currency.

CELL.P: Mandatory.
Applicable for Rating type = C or S
LC — in case of a local currency rating
FC — in case of a foreign currency rating.

ROW.CELL: LEI code of the legal entity/issuer. It shall be maintained unchanged over time.

CELL.P: Mandatory.
Applicable only if the rated entity is eligible for acquiring a LEI code.

ROW.CELL: Unique national fiscal code of the rated entity. It shall be maintained unchanged over time.

CELL.P: Optional.
If applicable.

ROW.CELL: Legal entity/issuer value added tax (VAT) code
Unique national VAT code of the rated entity. It shall be maintained unchanged over time.

CELL.P: Optional.
If applicable.

ROW.CELL: Unique BIC of the rated entity. It shall be maintained unchanged over time.

CELL.P: Optional.
Applicable only for entities that represent financial institutions (Industry = FI or IN).

ROW.CELL: Unique internal identifier of the issuer. It shall be maintained unchanged over time.
It shall contain appropriate understandable reference to the legal name of the legal entity/issuer.
LEI code of the parent company. To be reported only in case the rated issuer is a subsidiary of another rated entity. It shall be maintained unchanged over time.

CELL.P: Mandatory.
Applicable if the rated entity/debt issuer is a subsidiary of another rated entity.

ROW.CELL: Unique internal identifier of the parent entity/issuer. It shall be maintained unchanged over time.

CELL.P: Mandatory.
Applicable if the rated entity is a subsidiary of another rated entity.

ROW.CELL: Sub-sovereign Nomenclature of Territorial Units for Statistics (NUTS) code
Identifier of the city/region of the rated municipality/sub-sovereign.

CELL.P: Mandatory.
Applicable only for Country is part of the Union and for Rating type = S and Sector = SM

ROW.CELL: International Securities Identifying Number (ISIN) of the rated instrument. It shall be maintained unchanged over time.

CELL.P: Mandatory.
Applicable for Rated object = INT and if the rated instruments has an ISIN allocated.

ROW.CELL: A combination of instrument’s attributes that uniquely identifies the instrument.
Unique code to identify the financial instrument that is rated. It shall be maintained unchanged over time.

CELL.P: Mandatory.
Applicable for Rated object = INT.

ROW.CELL: Indicates the issue/programme type of the rating.

CELL.P: Optional.
Applicable for Rating type = C or S and Rated object = INT.

ROW.CELL: Valid Issue/programme type identifier, previously reported in the Issue/programme type list.

CELL.P: Mandatory.
Applicable for Rating type = C and for Rated object = ISR

ROW.CELL: Valid Issuer rating type identifier, previously reported in the Issuer rating type list.
Specifies the debt category for the rated issues or debts.

CELL.P: Mandatory.
Applicable for Rating type = C or S and Rated object = ISR and Issuer rating type = DT or Rated object = INT if applies.

ROW.CELL: Valid Rated debt classification identifier, previously reported in the Debt categories list.
Specifies the issuance date of the rated instrument or debt issuance. It shall be maintained unchanged over time.

CELL.P: Mandatory.
Applicable for Rated object = INT.

ROW.CELL: The maturity date of the rated instrument or debt issuance.

CELL.P: Mandatory.
Applicable for Rated object = INT.
If perpetual: 9999-01-01.

ROW.CELL: The outstanding issue volume at first rating issuance. The amount shall be reported in the currency of the issuance reported in Outstanding issue volume currency code.

CELL.P: Mandatory.
Applicable for Rated object = INT.

ROW.CELL: The code of the currency of the rated issue.

CELL.P: Mandatory.
Applicable for Rated object = INT.

ROW.CELL: Categorisation of the rated entity or debt issuances reported under the corporate rating type in financial, insurance and non-financial corporates.

CELL.P: Mandatory.
Applicable for Rating type = C.
FI — for financial institution rating including banks, brokers and dealers
IN — for insurance institution rating
CO — for corporate institution rating that is not included in FI or IN

ROW.CELL: Specifies subcategories for sovereign and public finance ratings.

CELL.P: Mandatory.
Applicable for Rating type = S.
SV — for State rating
SM — for regional or local authority rating
IF — for international financial institution rating
SO — for supranational organisations rating other than IF
PE — for public entities rating.

ROW.CELL: Defines the main asset classes for structured finance ratings.

CELL.P: Mandatory.
Applicable for Rating type = T.
ABS — for ABS rating
RMBS — for RMBS rating
CMBS — for CMBS rating
CDO — for CDO rating
ABCP — for ABCP rating
OTH — for other.

ROW.CELL: Defines the sub-asset classes for the structured finance ratings.

CELL.P: Mandatory.
Applicable for Rating type = T.
CCS — if ABS: credit card receivable backed securities
ALB — if ABS: auto loan backed securities
CNS — if ABS: consumer loan backed security
SME — if ABS: small and medium-sized enterprises loan backed securities
LES — if ABS: leases to individual or business backed security
HEL — if RMBS: home equity loans
PRR — if RMBS: prime RMBS, NPR — if RMBS: non-prime RMBS
CFH — if CDO: cash flow and hybrid CDOs/CLOs
SDO — if CDO: synthetic CDOs/CLOs
MVO — if CDO: market value CDOs
SIV — if OTH: structured investment vehicles
ILS — if OTH: insurance-linked securities
DPC — if OTH: derivative product companies
SCB — if OTH: structured covered bonds
OTH — other.

ROW.CELL: Indicates the other asset or sub-asset class category.

CELL.P: Mandatory.
Applicable for Rating-type = T and Sub-asset = OTH.
Mandatory.
Applicable for Rating type = C and Rated object = INT.
BND —bonds

CBR — covered bonds as referred to in Article 52(4) of Directive 2009/65/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council and that meet the eligibility requirements set out in Article 129 of Regulation (EU) No 575/2013

OCB — other types of covered bonds, for which the credit rating agency has used specific covered bonds methodologies, models or key rating assumptions for issuing the credit rating and which are not included in point (b) of Article 5(2) of this Regulation
OTH — other types of corporate issues which are not included in points (a), (b) and (c) of Article 5(2) of this Regulation..

ROW.CELL: Describes the type of issue reported under the other category of corporate issues.

CELL.P: Mandatory.
Applicable for Corporate issues classifications = OTH.
Mandatory.
Applicable for Rating type = T.

ROW.CELL: In case the issue is part of a series of multiple issuances under the same programme, it shall specify the issue’s specific series number. Programme ID could be added, where this exists, to complement the Programme/deal/issuance name.

CELL.P: Optional.
Applicable for Rating type = T or ‘Rating type = C and Rated object = INT.

ROW.CELL: Specifies the programme/deal/issuance name used in the public issuance documents

CELL.P: Optional.
Applicable for Rated object = INT.

ROW.CELL: Unique internal code assigned by the credit rating agency to the originator.

CELL.P: Mandatory.
Applicable for Rating type = T.
In case of multiple originators that cannot be individually identified, MULTIPLE should be reported.
Mandatory.
Applicable for Rating type = T and Originator Internal Identifier is not MULTIPLE.
Optional.
Applicable for Rating type = T and Originator Internal Identifier is not MULTIPLE.

ROW.CELL: It shall contain appropriate understandable reference to the legal name of the originator (or the parent company of the issuer).

CELL.P: Mandatory.
Applicable for Rating type = T and Originator internal identifier is not MULTIPLE.

ROW.CELL: For all the new ratings it specifies if the credit rating agency issued a preliminary rating or initial review before issuing the final rating.

CELL.P: Mandatory.
Applicable for Action type = NEW in Table 2 of Part 2
Y — yes
N — no

ROW.CELL: Indicates the rating identifier of the preceding issued preliminary rating or initial review. The Preceding preliminary rating identifier should correspond to an already reported valid preliminary rating Rating identifier.

CELL.P: Mandatory.
Applicable for Preceding preliminary rating = Y

ROW.CELL: Indicates the complexity grade assigned to a structured finance rating considering factors such as the number of originators, counterparties, countries, the need to develop new methodologies or new innovative features, credit enhancements, underlying documentation, complex collateral, different or new jurisdictions and/or existence of derivative components amongst other factors that may be considered relevant by the CRA when it is assessing the complexity of a rating service.

CELL.P: Mandatory.
Applicable for Rating type = T.
S — standard complexity
C — additional complexity

ROW.CELL: Indication of whether the instrument refers to a stand-alone or master-trust.

CELL.P: Mandatory.
Applicable for Rating type = T.
S — stand-alone transaction
M — master trust transaction

ROW.CELL: Identifies the credit ratings that fall under the scope of ERP, based on the requirements set out in Article 11a of the Regulation (EC) No 1060/2009.

CELL.P: NXI — the rating is not exclusively produced for and disclosed to investors for a fee
EXI — the rating is exclusively produced for and disclosed to investors for a fee

ROW.CELL: Indicates if the rating shall be used for CEREP statistics calculation.

CELL.P: Y — yes
N — no

P.HT: Data about the individual credit rating actions

GR.SEQ.P: This table contains all the rating actions that are issued in relation to the credit ratings reported in Table 1. Where the press releases or the sovereign research reports are issued in multiple languages, multiple versions of the press releases or the sovereign research reports can be reported for the same rating action.

ROW.CELL: Unique identifier of the rating action. Rating action identifier shall be unique per each reported rating.
Should be a valid Rating identifier reported in Table 1 of Part 2
The date and time of validity of the action. This shall coincide with the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) of publication of the action or distribution by subscription.
ISO 8601 extended date time format: YYYY-MM-DD (HH:MM:SS)

CELL.P: The date and time of communication of the action to the rated entity.
It shall be expressed as Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). Should be reported only for the ratings issued in the Union.
Mandatory.
Applicable for Location of the rating issuance = I.

ROW.CELL: ISO 8601 extended date time format: YYYY-MM-DD (HH:MM:SS)

CELL.P: Identifies the date when the action is decided.
It shall be the date of preliminary approval (such as by the rating committee) of the action where this is then communicated to the rated entity before final approval.
Should be reported only for the ratings issued in the Union.
Mandatory.
Applicable for Location of the rating issuance = I.

ROW.CELL: Identifies the type of action carried out by the credit rating agency with respect to a specific rating.

CELL.P: OR — in case of outstanding rating (only for first time reporting)
PR — in case of preliminary rating
NW — in case the rating is issued for the first time
UP — in case the rating is upgraded
DG — in case the rating is downgraded
AF — in case the rating is affirmed
DF — in case a rated issuer or instrument is assigned to or removed from a default status and the default is not linked with another rating action
SP — in case the rating is suspended
WD — in case the rating is withdrawn
OT — in case the rating is placed to or removed from the outlook/trend status
WR — in case the rating is placed to or removed from the watch/review status

ROW.CELL: An outlook/watch/suspension/default status is assigned, kept or removed with respect to the rating,

CELL.P: Mandatory.
Applicable for Action type = OT,WR, DF, SP or OR
P — status is placed
M — status is maintained
R — status is removed

ROW.CELL: Identifies the outlook/trend assigned to a rating by the CRA according to its relevant policy.

CELL.P: Mandatory.
Applicable for Action type = OT and OR
POS — in case of a positive outlook
NEG — in case of a negative outlook
EVO — in case of an evolving or developing outlook
STA — in case of a stable outlook

ROW.CELL: Identifies the watch or review status assigned to a rating by the CRA according to its relevant policy.

CELL.P: Mandatory.
Applicable for Action type = WR and OR
POW — in case of a positive watch/review
NEW — in case of a negative watch/review
EVW — in case of an evolving or developing watch/review
UNW — in case of a watch/review with uncertain direction

ROW.CELL: Identifies the reason for the watch/review status of a rating. Should be reported only for the ratings issued in the Union.

CELL.P: Mandatory.
Applicable for Action type = WR and OR and Location of the rating issuance = I.
1 — where the watch/review status is due to changes in methodologies, models or key rating assumptions
2 — where the watch/review status is due to economic, financial or credit reasons
3 — where the watch or review status is due to other reasons (e.g. departure of analysts, occurrence of conflicts of interests)

ROW.CELL: Identifies the reason of a withdrawal action.

CELL.P: Mandatory.
Applicable for Action Type = WD
1 — in case of incorrect or insufficient information on issuer/issue
2 — in case of bankruptcy of the rated entity or debt restructuring
3 — in case of reorganisation of rated entity (including the merger or acquisition of the rated entity)
4 — in case of the end of maturity of the debt obligation, or in case the debt is redeemed, called, prefunded, cancelled
5 — in case of automatic invalidity of rating due to business model of CRA (such as expiry of ratings valid for a predetermined period)
6 — in case of rating withdrawal due to other reasons
7 — in case the rating is affected by one of the points specified in Annex I, Section B, Point 3 of the Regulation (EC) No 1060/2009
8 — in case of client’s request

ROW.CELL: Where the rating was withdrawn due to other reasons than the ones provided, please specify the reason

CELL.P: Mandatory.
Applicable for Withdrawal reason = 6

ROW.CELL: Where the rated entity or the financial instrument is defaulted or removed from default as a result of another rating action (i.e.: upgrade, downgrade)

CELL.P: Mandatory.
Applicable for Action type = AF, DG, UP or OR
Y — yes
N — no

ROW.CELL: Specifies the reason for a suspension action.

CELL.P: Mandatory.
Applicable for Action type = SP

ROW.CELL: Identifies the rating scale used for issuing the rating action.

CELL.P: Mandatory.
Applicable for Action type = NW or UP or AF or DG or PR or OR

ROW.CELL: Valid Rating scale identifier, previously reported in the Rating scale table.
Notch value assigned by the credit rating agency as a result of the rating action.

CELL.P: Mandatory.
Applicable for Action type = NW or UP or AF or DG or PR or OR

ROW.CELL: Valid Notch value, previously reported in the Rating scale table.

Specifies the location of the issuance of the credit ratings by: ratings issued in the Union by a registered credit rating agency, ratings issued by third country credit rating agency belonging to the same group of credit rating agencies and endorsed in the Union, ratings issued by certified credit rating agencies or ratings issued by third country credit rating agency belonging to the same group of credit rating agencies but not endorsed in the Union.

CELL.P: I — issued in the Union
E — endorsed
T — issued in a third country by a certified CRA
O — other (not endorsed)
N — not available (only valid before 1.1.2011).

ROW.CELL: Unique identifier of the lead analyst responsible for the rating. Should be reported only for the ratings issued in the Union.

CELL.P: Mandatory.
Applicable for Location of the rating issuance = I.

ROW.CELL: Valid Lead analyst internal identifier, previously reported in the Lead analysts list.
Identifies the country of the office where the responsible lead analyst was located when issuing the rating.

CELL.P: Mandatory.
Applicable for Location of the rating issuance = I.

ROW.CELL: Solicitation status of the rated entity/instrument.

CELL.P: S — if the rating is solicited,
U — if the rating is unsolicited without participation
P — if the rating is unsolicited with participation.

ROW.CELL: Specifies if the rating action was accompanied by a press release.

CELL.P: Mandatory.
Applicable for Type of rating for ERP = NXI.
Y — yes
N — no.

ROW.CELL: Indicates the language in which the press release was issued.

CELL.P: Mandatory.
Applicable for Press release = Y.

ROW.CELL: Indicates the file name under which the press release was reported.

CELL.P: Mandatory.
Applicable for Press release = Y.

ROW.CELL: Where the rating action is accompanied by the same press release as another rating action, it should state the Action identifier for the action for which the common press release was firstly submitted.

CELL.P: Mandatory.
Applicable for press releases that relate to more than one rating action.

ROW.CELL: Specifies if the rating action was accompanied by a research report. Applicable only for sovereign ratings reported under the sector: SV or SM or IF

CELL.P: Mandatory.
Applicable for Rating type = S and Sector = SV or SM or IF
Y — yes
N — no

ROW.CELL: Indicates the language under which the research report was issued.

CELL.P: Mandatory.
Applicable for Sovereign Research Report = Y

ROW.CELL: Indicates the file name under which the research report was reported.

CELL.P: Mandatory.
Applicable for Sovereign Research Report = Y

ROW.CELL: Where the rating is accompanied by the same research report as another rating action, it should state the Action identifier for the action for which the common research report was firstly submitted.
